title: Vehicles
content:
Vehicles

State Regulations
§ 1220.50 - Vehicles not maintained, operated and registered in accordance with Port Authority rules and applicable laws, ordinances or regulations may be denied access to or removed from terminal
§ 1220.51 - Vehicles so loaded, constructed, operated, equipped or maintained as to endanger persons or property or obstruct traffic barred from terminal
§ 1220.52 - Vehicles having weights or dimensions in excess of described maxima or using prohibited fuels barred from terminal
§ 1220.53 - Vehicles lacking valid registration plate barred; exceptions
§ 1220.54 - Persons driving highway vehicles within terminal required to be duly licensed to operate such vehicles
§ 1220.55 - Passenger boarding and discharge areas to be used so as to avoid blocking egress of departing vehicles
§ 1220.56 - Procedure to be followed by driver in event of accident involving his vehicle
§ 1220.57 - Unauthorized tampering, starting, movement or interference with vehicles prohibited
§ 1220.58 - Permission required to fuel, defuel, lubricate, clean or repair vehicles within terminal
§ 1220.59 - Vehicles entering terminal required to extinguish headlights
§ 1220.60 - Prolonged sounding of vehicle horns prohibited
§ 1220.61 - Leaving vehicles unattended without turning off motor and setting brakes prohibited
§ 1220.62 - Vehicles prohibited from remaining in terminal for more than 30 minutes
§ 1220.63 - Operation of vehicles within terminal regulated
§ 1220.64 - Compliance with authorized traffic orders, signals, signs or directions required
§ 1220.65 - Drivers required to report arrival and departure and pay fees
§ 1220.66 - Disabled vehicles subject to removal
§ 1220.67 - Removal of vehicles from terminal to be at owner's or operator's risk and expense

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
